name: pixel-adb
description: Control the Android device via ADB: tap, swipe, type, screencap, dump UI, launch apps. Use when the user wants to control the phone, open an app, tap something, or see the screen. Requires ADB connected (e.g. Wireless debugging) and adb in PATH.

tools.name: adb_tap
tools.description: Tap the screen at (x, y). Use when the user says tap, click, or press at a position. Coordinates are in pixels.

tools.name: adb_swipe
tools.description: Swipe from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2). Use for scrolling, unlocking, or gestures. Duration in ms (default 300).

tools.name: adb_text
tools.description: Type text into the focused field. Use when the user wants to enter text, search, or type something. Spaces and special chars may need escaping.

tools.name: adb_screencap
tools.description: Take a screenshot. Returns path to the PNG file (on device). Use before describing the screen or finding tap coordinates.

tools.name: adb_ui_dump
tools.description: Dump the current window hierarchy to XML. Use to find bounds of buttons or text for tap coordinates.

tools.name: adb_launch_app
tools.description: Launch an app by package name (and optional activity). Use when the user says open X app. Example package: com.android.chrome

activity.description: Optional. Full activity class, e.g. .MainActivity. Omit to use default launch activity.
